# Contributing to FuelSOS ğŸš¨

Thank you for your interest in contributing to FuelSOS! This emergency fuel dispatch system is open to contributions from developers around the world.

## ğŸƒ Hacktoberfest 2025

This repository is participating in **Hacktoberfest 2025**! We welcome quality contributions from the community.

### How to Participate

1. **Register** for Hacktoberfest at [hacktoberfest.com](https://hacktoberfest.com)
2. **Find an Issue** - Check our [Issues](https://github.com/Lintshiwe/FuelSOS2.0/issues) page
3. **Fork** the repository
4. **Create** a new branch for your feature
5. **Make** your changes
6. **Submit** a Pull Request

### Valid Contributions

âœ… Bug fixes
âœ… New features
âœ… Documentation improvements
âœ… UI/UX enhancements
âœ… Performance optimizations
âœ… Test coverage improvements

### Guidelines

- Follow the existing code style
- Write clear commit messages
- Test your changes thoroughly
- Update documentation if needed
- Be respectful and constructive

## ğŸš€ Getting Started

### Prerequisites

- **Flutter SDK**: 3.35.5 or higher
- **Node.js**: 16.x or higher
- **Android Studio**: For Android development
- **VS Code**: Recommended IDE

### Setup Development Environment

```bash
# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/Lintshiwe/FuelSOS2.0.git
cd FuelSOS2.0

# Setup Frontend
cd frontend
flutter pub get
flutter run -d chrome

# Setup Backend (in new terminal)
cd backend
npm install
npm run dev
```

## ğŸ“ Pull Request Process

1. Update the README.md with details of changes if applicable
2. Update documentation for any new features
3. The PR will be merged once you have approval from maintainers
4. Ensure all tests pass before requesting review

## ğŸ·ï¸ Issue Labels

- `hacktoberfest` - Issues suitable for Hacktoberfest
- `good first issue` - Great for newcomers
- `bug` - Something isn't working
- `enhancement` - New feature or request
- `documentation` - Documentation improvements
- `help wanted` - Extra attention needed
